intro: Senecio walteri, commonly known as Walter's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by fluffy white seed heads. Senecio walteri is generally hardy and drought-tolerant, making it well adapted to its native habitat.
